Structure.Introduction: The explorer window consists of multiple nodes, that are organized in a tree hierarchy. The nodes are gathered from the system you are currently accessing. Every node has a different purpose; most are either sub-categories or log entries, but some may have a critical role, especially if you are accessing a foreign entity.

Commands.Move_Up: Type 'move up' to access the parent of your current node. It is currently displayed at the top of the hierarchy. A number can be appended to move multiple multiple levels up at once. Example: 'move up 2'
Commands.Open: Type 'open ' followed by the name of the node you are trying to access. Example: 'open Root'
Commands.Refresh: Type 'refresh' to reload the contents of your browser.
